t:
They say you can revisit places,
              but not the feelings you bore.
Memories of then,
             they don't live there anymore.
It's a truth that cuts to the core,
A truth I'd rather ignore.
c:
To all the places we've been, I've never dared to be,
For it only magnifies the truth, a truth we both see.
The old us, the same us, is no more.
It's a reality that makes my heart sore.

I'd rather stay still, not let my feet explore,
Than face the truth that you're a stranger once more.
A stranger with memories that I adore,
But a stranger nonetheless, forevermore.



If you are good with words, you might like this: https://sherlockdoyle.github.io/antonemo/ (link also available in profile)
